Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit a sacrifice fly to right, Perdomo scored.

Corbin Carroll ducked late into the Arizona Diamondbacks' clubhouse with his uniform pants stained in dirt — two stolen bases will get a player dirty — but was otherwise clean when he was spotted by the rest of his bubbly-bathed teammates.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks stun the Phillies 4-2 in Game 7 of NLCS to reach first World Series in 22 years.
The game was played at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania with an attendance of 45,397.
Others: Corbin Carroll was 3-4 with 2 runs scored and 2 RBIs.
The Phillies scored 2 runs in the 7th inning.
